abstract: Great Britain says it will provide 2 billion pounds, or about $3.1 billion, in state assistance for nuclear power plant planned in southwest England.
lead_paragraph: Britain said it would provide £2 billion as the government looks to China to help finance the new Hinkley Point station, which will cost at least £16 billion.

headline.main: In Courting Chinese Companies, Britain to Help Fund Planned Nuclear Plant
headline.print_headline: Britain Says It Will Aid Planned Nuclear Plant

snippet: Britain said it would provide £2 billion as the government looks to China to help finance the new Hinkley Point station, which will cost at least £16 billion.
